intro: Tritoma leichtlinii, commonly known as the desert tritoma, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Tritoma leichtlinii has a short lifespan, often completing its growth cycle within a single growing season. Its structure includes a basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that rises above the foliage.
